results.title: Childhood: the enchanted years
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of the physical and mental development of the child from birth to four years of age is presented in this film. Shows how children learn to reach, perceive, walk and talk. Of particular interest are the simple perceptual experiments which show the reactions of the psychological mechanisms of the child.

results.title: Childhood sexual abuse: four case studies
results.creator_credit: Dale McCulley, Cavalcade Productions and MTI Teleprograms
results.brief_description: In a weekend workshop setting, four women relive their experiences of early sexual molestation. Each of the women reveals a uniquely poignant story.

results.title: Child survival alliance
results.brief_description: Looks at Colombia’s massive attempt to immunize all its children. Three days a year are set aside by the government to give the children vaccines against polio, diptheria, whooping cough, tetanus and measles.

results.title: Child psychiatry: autism's lonely children
results.creator_credit: Jack Willis, Philip Burton, David Prowitt and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Explains the work of Dr. Frank Hewett in teaching autistic children to talk and identify objects. Shows work with a child and Dr. Hewett attempting to transfer to the child’s parents techniques used successfully to evoke responses. Discusses the possible effectiveness of the approach on other autistic children.

results.title: Child of the Philippines: no time to play
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte, Bryan H. Easte and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Highlights a day in the life of an eleven year old girl who lives in a back country village of the Philippines, and who has to work before and after an eleven hour school day. Explores the problem of children deprived of the basic right to adequate rest and relaxation.

results.title: Child development: infants are individuals
results.creator_credit: Clinic of Child Development and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The material in this film is taken from the Clinic’s photographic records made over a period of 20 years. Each child’s unique individuality asserts itself even in infancy. Bob, Amy, Bess, and Dan at the age of five, we look at their progress from about 12 weeks old to five years.

results.title: Child Care and Development
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Child care and development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
The film gives overall consideration to the habits of daily physical care that ensure a happy, healthy child. Correct attitudes and procedures toward establishing good habits of eating, sleeping, and bathing are covered. Stresses the elements of good diet. The question of proper clothing - warm and light for the infant, sturdy and functional for the toddler - is explored. Raises the important consideration of suitable and becoming clothing as exerting considerable psychological influence on personality development. The importance of outdoor exercise is stressed. The film shows the importance of the attitudes of both parents and children towards good routines of daily living.
